com.emc.vipr.transform

Class TransformFactory<T extends OutputTransform,U extends InputTransform>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emc.vipr.transform.TransformFactory<T,U>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the class of transform that this class produces.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<TransformFactory<OutputTransform,InputTransform>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompressionTransformFactory, EncryptionTransformFactory

    public abstract class TransformFactory<T extends OutputTransform,U extends InputTransform>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<TransformFactory<OutputTransform,InputTransform>>
    Abstract base class that produces both "output" transformers that encode data and "output" transforms that decode data.

    • Method Detail

      • getOutputTransform

        public abstract T getOutputTransform(java.io.OutputStream streamToEncode,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadataToEncode)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                                             TransformException
        Gets an "output" transform for the factory in its current state. This will be used to transform raw data on its way "out" to the server.
        Returns:
        a transform that can encode the outbound object stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        TransformException

      • getOutputTransform

        public abstract T getOutputTransform(java.io.InputStream streamToEncode,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadataToEncode)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                                             TransformException
        Gets an "output" transform for the factory in its current state. This will be used to transform raw data on its way "out" to the server. This version gets an output transform in "pull" mode that uses an input stream to filter the data. This is useful for situations where you need to pump data to an output stream like when using an HTTP output stream.
        Returns:
        a transform that can encode the outbound object stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        TransformException

      • getInputTransform

        public abstract U getInputTransform(java.lang.String transformConfig,
                  java.io.InputStream streamToDecode,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                                           TransformException
        Gets the "input" transform for the given class and metadata.
        Parameters:
        transformClass - the class of transform (in case a particular factory can handle multiple transform types)
        config - the configuration of the transformClass.
        metadata - metadata extracted from the inbound object (used to fine-tune the transformation and/or provide metadata to also be transformed).
        Returns:
        a transform that can decode the inbound object stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        TransformException

      • getTransformClass

        public abstract java.lang.String getTransformClass()
        Gets the high-level class of transform that this factory provides. The transform engine will use this to test whether the registered factory can decode the given object.
        Returns:
        the transformation class, e.g. "COMP" for compression or "ENC" for encryption.

      • canDecode

        public boolean canDecode(java.lang.String transformConfig,
                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Checks whether this class can decode the given transformation configuration.
        Parameters:
        transformClass - the transformation class to check, e.g. "COMP"
        config - the configuration for the transformation, e.g. "LZMA/9"
        metadata - the additional metadata from the object in case additional fields need to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if this factory can decode the given object stream.

      • splitTransformConfig

        protected java.lang.String[] splitTransformConfig(java.lang.String transformConfig)

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Gets the priority of this factory. For output configurations, higher priority transformations will be applied first (e.g. compression should be applied before encryption and therefore higher priority). For input configurations, there may be multiple factories that can handle an object and the one with higher priority will take precedence.
        Returns:
        this factory's priority.

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(int priority)
        Sets the priority for this factory.
        Parameters:
        priority -

        public int compareTo(TransformFactory<OutputTransform,InputTransform> other)
